body.p: 1. Eldest of three sons born to Esau by Oholibamah, daughter of the Canaanite Anah, and a chief among Esau’s descendants in Edom (Gn 36:5-18; 1 Chr 1:35).
2. Bilhan’s son from Jediael’s house and a leader in Benjamin’s tribe (1 Chr 7:10).
3. Benjamite, Eshek’s son and a descendant of Saul (1 Chr 8:39).

4. Levite from the family of Gershon and the third of Shimei’s four sons. Since he and his youngest brother, Beriah, had few sons, they were together considered one house during David’s reign (1 Chr 23:10-11).
5. Eldest of three sons born to King Rehoboam by Mahalath, Eliab’s granddaughter (2 Chr 11:19).
